name: Katie Moor
content: Professor Katie A. Siek Skip to content I am a full professor in Informatics at Indiana University – Bloomington. Â I am part of the ProHealth group where I integrate pervasive technologies in health and wellness environments to study how technology affects interventions. My research interests include human computer interaction, ubiquitous computing, and health informatics. (Formal Bio, CV). Preferred pronouns: she/her/hers Office Hours for Fall 2025: Until December 13: Fridays from 1-2p in Myles Brand Hall E260 except the following cancelled office hour days: No office hours on: November 7 If you need another appointment time, you can suggest one using the Outlook Scheduling Assistant Current and Recent Activities Chaired and co-organized the Computing Futures Showcase on Capitol Hill Joined ACM Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Council (2025-2027) Chaired and co-organized the CCC Computing Futures Symposium with Bob Bond (MIT Lincoln Laboratory), Elizabeth Bruce (Microsoft), Mark Hill (U. Wisconsin), Drew Lohn (Georgetown's Center for Security and Emerging Technology), Bill Regli (U. Maryland), and Weisong Shi (U. Delaware) Organized a panel at AAAS Annual Meeting 2025 – Untold Stories: Technology’s Role in Gendered Reproductive Care highlighting work by Wanda Pratt (U Washington), Nazanin Andalibi (U Michigan), and NoÃ©mie Elhadad (Columbia) Appointed to the IU Faculty Academy on Excellence in Teaching Leadership Institute (2023-2025) Co-organized Supporting At-Risk Users through Responsible Computing Named an Association of Computing Machinery Distinguished Member Education Ph.D.,Â Computer Science,Â Indiana University, 2006 M.S.,Â Computer Science,Â Indiana University, 2004 B.S., Computer Science,Â Eckerd College, 2000 Professional CV (Last Update: 02/2025) Publications Need a letter of recommendation?
